intro: Aster multiflorus, commonly known as the multibract aster, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
